content.description: Starts in a large chimney. Shimmy your way up until it starts getting tight. Move around the arete to some face and right handed arete moves to the top. Don’t touch the right wall where the chalk x’s are, that thing is a death sentence. Surprisingly clean on the FA, but still be on the lookout for other loose rocks.
content.protection: Perfect pine tree hanging off the edge for TR anchor.
content.location: Depends on the trail you use to get down. When looking from the lookout deck, it’s 50 feet to the left.

content.description: As the name implies, it was climbed with the numbest of fingers. Follows the line just left of “One Stick Thick”. Lots of side pull and crack moves to the top. Quality is slightly lowered by some loose rock at the bottom and near the top.Be extra careful on the first several moves, the main crack has a large loose stone that may or may not come out with some pulling.
content.protection: Perfect pine tree for TR. Shares anchor with “One Stick Thick”

content.description: Close to the lookout, a series of broken cliffs with really nice cracks, caves, off-widths, and face climbing. There are a few gorgeous potential routes in this section, one being called "Perfection Arete" which could produce a really sick sport climb. This section has a lot of potential and the rock is relatively clean. It is plagued by some sections of bad rock quality, but this can be avoided by toproping first or leading with caution.
